Dear Ms. Puga:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
October 13,2021. Due to the violations a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not
obtained and maintained compliance for rules found in repeat
noncompliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4108 Financing and audit.
A licensee shall do all of the following: (a) Obtain an annual
audit of all financial accounts. Audits for nongovernmental
institutions shall be conducted by an independent certified
public accountant who is not administratively related to the
agency.
The agency submitted a budget statement but did not submit an
independent annual financial audit. The administrator reported
the audit is pending for the last three annual periods.
Repeated Violations:
 Interim 2019-------------CAP Approved 12/27/19
 Renewal 2020-----------CAP Approved 10/19/20
 Interim 2021
Rule 400.416 Chief administrator; responsibilities.
(b) Develop and implement a written plan to correct, within
6 months, rule violations identified as a result of the
assessment conducted pursuant to subdivision (a) of this
subrule.
Chief Administrator did not comply with corrective action plan
submitted on 10/20/20 in reference to repeated violation for
Rule 108 (submitting an annual audit of all financial account by
a certified public accountant).
1

R 400.4111 Job descriptions.
An institution shall provide a job description for each staff
position that identifies rules, required qualifications,
and lines of authority.
There is no job description for the position of Social Service
Worker. The Clinical Therapist is performing the duties of a
Social Service Worker, those duties must be added to the
Clinical Therapist job description.
R 400.4119 Social service worker; qualifications.
A social service worker, at the time of appointment to the
position, shall possess a bachelor’s degree with a major in
a human behavioral science from 9 an accredited college or
university or another major with 25% of credits in human
behavioral sciences.
The case manager/administrator assistance is not qualified to
perform the duties of the social service worker. She has a
bachelor’s degree in science but does not have the required
25% credits in human behavioral sciences.
2. The facility does not serve plaintiff class youth, therefore, MISEP is not
applicable.
3. The facility does not contract with DHHS; therefore, is not required to follow
DHHS policies.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Rule 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
 The agency was advised that orientation and training hours shall be clearly
documented, logged, calculated, and filed in the employee file.
Rule 400.4116 Chief administrator; responsibilities
 The facility’s chain of command is inconsistent with licensing rules. The
organizational chart shows the chief administrator reporting to the social
the social service supervisor. However, the rules indicate the chief
2

administrator is responsible for the on-site day-to-day operation of the
institution and for ensuring compliance with these rules (including those
rules pertaining to social service work.) The social services supervisor
should report to the chief administrator.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 The facility is currently in transition from paper to an electronic file system and
it is recommended that they maintain a paper file as a backup until fully
transitioned.
 The facility is recommended to conduct internal audits to ensure compliance
with each rule.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
The facility submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The investigation involved staff allowing a
resident to use her vape pen. The corrective action plan included the staff person
involved was terminated and training current staff regarding boundaries and
complying with facility’s policy and rules.
The corrective action plan related to the 2020 Renewal Inspection where it received
the following citations:
 Rule 400.4108 Financing and audit
 Rule 400.4113 Employee records
 Rule 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
 R 400.4128 Initial Staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
The agency was not completely successful with the corrective action plan as
indicated by the repeated violations documented in this report. The agency hired a
new Chief of Administrator that will ensure compliance with the corrective action plan
and rules to eliminate repeated rule violations.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility continue their regular license.
